meaningMnemonic:
An <kanji>astray</kanji> <kanji>child</kanji> is nothing more than a <vocabulary>lost child</vocabulary>, looking for home. You see them looking around, confused and teary-eyed. Help them find their way home — be a hero to this lost child!

Even though 迷子 has 子 (child) in it, it's really more about being lost. So it can also mean a <vocabulary>lost person</vocabulary> or even a <vocabulary>stray animal</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: The reading for 迷 is an exceptional reading. The ご comes from こ. Think of the まい as the child asking: "Where is <reading>my</reading> (まい) mommy???"
